Definition: Operator that evaluates the function name on the left-hand-side (LHS) of the opening parentheses using the arguments enclosed by the parentheses
Infix operator that assigns an object on the right-hand-side (RHS) to a name on the left-hand-side (LHS) -- this should be used for global assignments!
Infix operator that assigns an object on the right-hand-side (RHS) to a name on the left-hand-side (LHS) -- this should not be used for global assignments!
The formula operator separates the left- and right-hand sides (LHS and RHS) in a formula.
Infix operator that generates a regular sequence of adjacent values
Infix operator that can be used to access a package environment without attaching the whole package environment to your current session
Extraction operator used to index multiple values from a data object (LHS) based on the position or values specified inside the brackets
Extraction operator used to index a single value from a data object (LHS) based on the position or values specified inside the brackets
Infix operator that extracts the values associated with a name (RHS) from a recursive object (LHS)
Infix relational operator (is equal to)
Infix relational operator (is not equal to)
Prefix logical operator (not)
Prefix logical operator (and)
Prefix logical operator (or)
Infix relational operator (greater than)
Infix relational operator (less than)
Infix relational operator (less than or equal to)
Infix arithmetic operator (addition)
Infix arithmetic operator (subtract) or prefix negative symbol operator
Infix arithmetic operator (divide)
Transform an atomic vector to a character vector
Transform an atomic vector to an integer vector
Transform an atomic vector to an double numeric vector (i.e., decimal numbers)
Generate and print a list that represents the attributes of a data object
Combine values to form an atomic vector
Print the class of an object as a one-value character vector
Return the number of dimensions of an object as an integer vector
Return the number of values in an atomic vector or the number of list items in a list (or data frame!) as a one-value integer vector
Combine multiple objects of any type into a single, recursive, data object
Return the highest value in a numeric vector (integer or double) as a one-value numeric or integer vector (depending on input)
Return the lowest value in a numeric vector (integer or double) as a one-value numeric or integer vector (depending on input)
Retrieve the names (or names attribute) assigned to an R object (generates a character vector)
Calculate the sum of the values in a vector
Infix relational operator that tests whether the vector on the left-hand-side (LHS) is within the vector on the right
Create a data frame
Print the environment of a given function
Convert a character vector to a factor
Delete a file from your hard drive
Generate a character vector of factor levels in a factor variable
Attach the package environment for a given package to the current R session
List files in a specified folder on your computer's hard drive
Generate a character vector of names in a specified environment (default is the global environment)
Generate a matrix object by adding dimensional attributes to an atomic vector
Generate a one-value double numeric vector that describes the mean of a vector
Return the number of columns (i.e., variables or list items) in a data frame as a one-value integer vector
Return the number of rows (i.e., observations) in a data frame as a one-value integer vector
Remove a name from a specified environment (default is the global environment)
Print a character vector of attached objects associated with your current R session
Print summary stats for a data object
Convert a character vector to lowercase
Count the number of unique observations in an atomic vector
Print a one-value character vector that represents how a data object is stored on our computer
Subset an atomic vector to the unique values in the set
Sort the rows of a data frame by the values in a variable or variables
Combine two variables or columns of two tibbles to create a new tibble
When used with `arrange()`, this sorts the rows of a data frame by the values of a variable in descending order
Calculate the number of observations (rows)
Change the name assigned to a column in a data frame
Subset columns in a data frame by name (without quotes!)
Subset a data frame to the first row (default) or rows
Subset a data frame to the last row (default) or rows
Calculate one or more summary statistics on a variable or variables in a data frame (often used in conjunction with `group_by()` but may also be used with `.by = ...`)
View the structure of an object in your computer's memory
The pipe operator passes the output of the LHS argument to the function on the right
Read a tabular csv file into R as a tibble data frame
Read an atomic vector into R
Read an RDS file into R
Write a data frame to your hard drive as a csv file
Write an atomic vector to your hard drive as a txt file
Write a data object to your hard drive as an RDS file
Return the names of worksheets in an Excel file
Read an Excel worksheet into R
Assign names to values in a vector or items in a list
Calculate the median value of a numeric vector and return as a one-value double numeric or integer vector
Calculate the standard deviation of a numeric vector and return as a one-value double numeric vector
Calculate the variance of a numeric vector and return as a one-value double numeric vector
Concatenate strings, with or without (default) a separator
Apply a base R-style plot to a terra raster object
Column-wise creation of a tibble data frame
Row-wise creation of a tibble data frame
Generate a character vector of package names in the tidyverse metapackage
Update packages in the tidyverse metapackage

Download and install one or more packages onto your computer
View the version history of a package
